key_risks: Supply chain vulnerabilities due to global disruptions and material price volatility
Economic sensitivity tied to cyclical industries like construction and agriculture
Competitive pressures from larger players and low-cost manufacturers
Rising compliance costs from stringent environmental regulations
controversies: Lawsuit alleging age discrimination (Sharon Wharton v. Gorman-Rupp Company)
Need to adhere to anti-bribery laws (e.g., U.S. Foreign Corrupt Practices Act, U.K. Bribery Act)
environmental_issues: Increasingly stringent environmental regulations and associated compliance costs
social_issues: Ensuring ethical labor practices, including zero tolerance for child or forced labor
governance_issues: Concentration of institutional ownership (64%) leading to potential volatility
